Package imagingbook.common.regions

Class DepthFirstSegmentation

  • java.lang.Object
    • imagingbook.common.regions.BinaryRegionSegmentation
      • imagingbook.common.regions.DepthFirstSegmentation
  • public class DepthFirstSegmentation
extends BinaryRegionSegmentation

    Binary region segmentation based on a depth-first flood filling algorithm using a stack. See Sec. 8.1.1 (Alg. 8.2) of [1] for additional details.

    [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).

    Version:
    2020/04/01, 2022/09/28 revised

    • Constructor Detail

      • DepthFirstSegmentation

        public DepthFirstSegmentation​(ij.process.ByteProcessor ip)
        Constructor. Creates a new region segmentation from the specified image, which is not modified. The input image is considered binary, with 0 values for background pixels and values ≠ 0 for foreground pixels. The 4-neighborhood is used by default (BinaryRegionSegmentation.DEFAULT_NEIGHBORHOOD).
        Parameters:
        ip - the binary input image to be segmented

      • DepthFirstSegmentation

        public DepthFirstSegmentation​(ij.process.ByteProcessor ip,
                              NeighborhoodType2D nh)
        Constructor. Creates a new region segmentation from the specified image and neighborhood type (4- or 8-neighborhood). The input image is considered binary, with 0 values for background pixels and values ≠ 0 for foreground pixels.
        Parameters:
        ip - the binary input image to be segmented
        nh - the neighborhood type (4- or 8-neighborhood)
